intro: Psoralidium stenostachys, commonly known as the narrow-stalked psoralidium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, clustered umbels of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. The species is noted for its chemical composition, containing various bioactive compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
